timeline.bodyText: How does this differ from the other offerPlanksRecipe? (for example, is it only used for fungus planks or wooden planks)
timeline.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText:
Why do some of these use offer (as in offerCandleDyeingRecipe or offerStoneCutterRecipe), while others use create (as in createSlabRecipe or createPressurePlateRecipe)?

create is the name used to create net/minecraft/data/server/recipe/***RecipeJsonFactorys, but there is a separate pull request #1940 for changing the names of those since they are very confusing so a name change might be in place here as well.
Similarly, offer is used because it was already mapped in the RecipeJsonFactory's, the difference between these kinds of functions is that the latter actually offers the recipe to the consumer via createRecipe().offerTo(consumer);, to reduce code duplication probably.

How does this differ from the other offerPlanksRecipe? (for example, is it only used for fungus planks or wooden planks)

I think it's a bug or perhaps a typo, it's only used for Dark Oak and Acacia planks, it does the exact same thing but using a different "has_log" criteria (the other offerPlanksRecipe function has the "has_logs" criteria).
replies.author: yyny
